newsitem.title: UK: Bryant Group buys Admiral Homes.
newsitem.headline: Bryant Group buys Admiral Homes.

text.p: UK housebuilder Bryant Group Plc said on Wednesday it was buying Admiral Homes Ltd for a total of 64.2 million stg including debt.

Bryant will pay 4.2 million stg in cash and will take on Admiral's net borrowings of 58.0 million stg. Bryant, which said net home reservations were 25 percent ahead of a year ago since its May 31 year-end, said the acquisition would put it in a strong position to take advantage of an improving housing market.
Admiral has 47 sites totalling some 1,750 plots, with work in progress on 30 of the sites as of April 30.

Admiral made an operating profit before exceptional items of 2.0 million stg on turnover of 69.3 million in the year ended April 30. Its principal asset is 57.8 million stg of housebuilding land and work in progress.
In its results statement, Bryant chief executive Andrew MacKenzie said there was currently considerable optimism about likely house price rises.
"While the reality is likely to be a more modest improvement, public confidence is growing and the signs look more favourable than for some time," he said.
